alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 7:26AM CST until February 28 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Knox, Morgan and Union. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 826 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in the area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oak Ridge, Clinton, Maynardville, Wartburg, Oliver Springs, Plainview, Blaine, Rocky Top, Norris, Luttrell, Oakdale, Norris Dam State Park, Andersonville, Rosedale, Big Ridge State Park, Paulette, Petros, Coalfield and Frozen Head State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
